definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Tomb-Sweeping Day comes when people go to the tombs of the deceased to pay their respect.
sentences.chinese: 清明节到了，正是给已故的人扫墓上坟的日子。

sentences.english: Graves are visited and fires might be lit to guide the spirits home.
sentences.chinese: 人们会去坟上上坟并给点起火把给回家的灵魂引路。

sentences.english: Did not give him strange people poor.
sentences.chinese: 没人给他上坟怪可怜的。

sentences.english: Today also happens to be the anniversary of the death of my newborn daughter, whose grave I would normally visit.
sentences.chinese: 今天正好是我小女儿的忌日，通常我是要去上坟的。

sentences.english: This grave, the shrine of the dead an activity.
sentences.chinese: 扫墓俗称上坟，祭奠死者的一种活动。

sentences.english: Our whole family is going south to pay our respects at our grandparents' gravesite.
sentences.chinese: 我们全家人要去南部为祖父母上坟。

sentences.english: He talked with some women who had come to his tomb.
sentences.chinese: 他和一些给他上坟的妇女交谈。

definition: to sweep a grave (and pay one's respects to the dead person)
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
Qingming or Pure Brightness Festival or Tomb Sweeping Day, celebration for the dead (in early April)
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
Ghost Festival on 15th day of 7th lunar month when offerings are made to the deceased
ritual money made of paper burnt for the Gods or the dead
last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
